column2: commonly referred to as CS Sedan or simply Sedan (French pronunciation: ​[sədɑ̃])
column3: is a French association football club based in Sedan. The club was formed in 1919 and plays its home matches at the Stade Louis Dugauguez located within the city.  Sedan is sponsored by Invicta France and Caisse d'Épargne
column4: the latter being one of France's largest banks.

column1: Sedan's home strip always includes red and green
column2: and this is reflected in the club badge. The badge also incorporates the image of a wild boar
column3: a symbol of the Ardennes region
column4: hence the club's nickname is Les Sangliers (the wild boars).

column1: Sedan's fanbase is mainly drawn from the surrounding Ardennes region
column2: and particular rivalry is reserved for the derby with nearby club Stade Reims. Although not known for outbreaks of hooliganism
column3: a Sedan home game against Paris Saint Germain in 2007 was widely reported following the arrival of Dutch football hooligans from Utrecht and their ensuing fight with PSG fans.

column1: Sedan does have a small hooligan faction known as the Young Boys
column2: complete with their own designated stadium corner and even their own online gift shop.

column1: Note: Flags indicate national team as defined under FIFA eligibility rules. Players may hold more than one non-FIFA nationality.
Below are the notable former players who have represented Sedan in league and international competition since the club's foundation in 1919. To appear in the section below
column2: a player must have played in at least 80 official matches for the club or represented the national team for which the player is eligible during his stint with Sedan or following his departure.
